Reviews.Title: “Typical Best Western”
Reviews.Author: Beenaround73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sept '10. Hotel is located in a part of town with lots of traffic because it's close to the entrance to the Lincoln tunnel and the Javits Center is a couple blocks away. With that said it's location is also a plus because the Port Authority terminal and Penn Station are within walking distance. The best thing about being in this part of town is that feels a lot like NY did before it started it's latest renaissance of sleek condo towers and chic hotels and restaurants. In this part of town there are a pizza stand that has no sitting area, a classic bagel place, and small family owned bodegas and the best part is the price reflects it. Of course there are also the newer restaurants and other places trying to make it, but they are sprinkled throughout and not necessarily concentrated in one particular area. Picked this hotel after canceling a reservation at another nearby place. It was last minute and wound up being lucky because I got the last room. A couple came in as I was filling out paperwork and they were told the hotel was full. Whew! Although it was just me, I wound up with a room with 2 full size beds. The room was just big enough to fit both beds, TV console with TV, and small desk with chair. The room's decor seemed outdated. The bathroom was basic and not much to write home about. Breakfast was simple and the dining area was a bit small. Just got my little bit of food and ate up in the room. Again, plenty of options to eat around so just treat yourself elsewhere. For the price it was not bad but had I planned better probably could have found something better for less. Since it was just a place to sleep at night, no major complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Exelent sleep & location, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Nekdo
Reviews.Content: Best value for money if you attend conference or event near Time Square. Small hotel, but it has everything you need. Free wireless. Most comfortable mattress that I've ever slept on in hotels worldwide. Breakfast is very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Room was alright, staff were horrible”
Reviews.Author: P F
Reviews.Content: I read alot of bad reviews with this hotel in terms of not being clean. So i went to the hotel expecting nothing. The rooms however were better than what I expected it to be. The bed mattress was pretty good. Only problems I had with the room was of course space, it's pretty tight. There is not alot of area to walk around in the room. Another problem I found is the carpet is not vacumed and also they don't put a plastic bag for the bin in the bathroom. A bag is like 10 cents, come on seriously. Now talking about breakfast. it's a rip off. a friend of mine(who was not staying at the hotel) had breakfast with us and they charged her $20. the breakfast is not worth $20- it's like cold food(bagels, juice, muffin) sometimes they have scrambled eggs and it tastes soo fake like powdered egg. another issue is the cleaners are the so called "chefs" at best western is kind of gross. Safety- there are no nearby hotels in that area so i was initially abit scared because I was travelling with friends. It's not that bad- there were these weird drunk ppl who were always at the 38th and 11th av(the intersection closest to the hotel) at 10pm, just have to look away and walk past them. that's the only tackle. Last but not least. Management is TERRIBLE. Annie seriously has problems and there is another male manager there. there were soo rude to us. Not all the staff are rude, it's just the managers.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in august 2011 for 5 nights and really it was amazing. How come? The staff who are very very friendly, the small (= you don't need a big room in NY, you're never in) but clean rooms, breakfast included, very close to Times Square, do I have to say more.....:-) and our dear friend Julio. We miss you. Family from Belgium.

Reviews.Title: “clean and adequate”
Reviews.Author: Alison O
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay (Feb. 2012), again found the hotel clean and adequate for my needs, a good base to explore without breaking the bank. Rooms pretty tight, a larger person might have trouble getting to the far side of the bed but didn't plan to spend time there anyway. Beds seemed to have memory foam, very comfortable. Front desk very helpful when I requested a room further from the elevator (10th floor). Breakfast good (free!) with bagels, apples and bananas, endless coffee! Close to garment district, not a long walk to Times Square and the west side ped/bike path on the Hudson River, my favorite part of visiting NY.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Convention Centre New York”
Reviews.Author: sbjohari
Reviews.Content: Was in New York in Apr 1st 2010 (please ignore the April 2011 choice that TripAdvisor gave to me, i cant select Apr 2010). Was there for 2 weeks and stayed in the same hotel for the entire duration. Previously on my earlier trip to New York, i stayed at Comfort Inn Convention Centre but the hotel price had gone. Best Western was the next cheapest available. This hotel is nearer to the Port Authority station. As a muslim couple, we had no issues getting halal pizza's nearby and there is this nearby Pakistani place that sells delicious (but oily) dishes that will sure to clog up the artery soon enough. We went there to go on a shopping trip (FACTORY OUTLETS) bender. Anyway back to the hotel, area is safe (cause i frequently went out alone and came back wayyyy after midnight), there is a taxi workshop facing the hotel, a train track passing nearby (barely notice them) and a near by building where they keep the horses (as long as you don't walk past it, you wouldn't notice they were there) Had no problems with the staff, the breakfast dining room is small but adequate. Breakfast no complains for non fussy persons. Going to New York again but prices have gone up *sigh* .... so staying in a place we got through http://www.airbnb.com/ now.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel with everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: AALNYC
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the best western for four nights! Complimentary breakfast was gorgeous loads to go around and eat as much as you want! Staffing was brilliant and a great help especially manager Annie and Mike. Rooms are very simple but very clean with a television and heating. Maids come in everyday. Overall great stay would recommend to anybody even the area of hotel not far from times square on the hop on hop off tour bus.

Reviews.Title: “Attending convention at Jacob Javit's center this be prime spot proximity wise. It is just right across street when you”
Reviews.Author: jaypee0501
Reviews.Content: Best location if you are attending an event in Jacob Javits center. It is literally right outside. The rooms are typical NYC rooms small but functional. The price you pay is worth it if you are just there for business. I would definitely stay here again if I have a convention to attend to. Breakfast is merely basic. But atleast its free. Elevators were not working day we were to check out but the front desk lady let us check out late so we can leave our bag in our room til we get back. Small hotel but does the job!

Reviews.Title: “new york oct 2011”
Reviews.Author: ladyallyb
Reviews.Content: well, what can i say, our family which was 2 adults and an 8yr old stayed at the best western w38 & 10th for 10 days in oct 2011.. this hotel was clean at all times, the room had 2 double beds, bathroom,television and coffee making facilities.. the room was ample size and very comfortable.. the hotel offered free continental breakfastwhich was aplenty from fruit to danish..free internet, morning papers and an ice machine.. nothing was too much for the staff..we would go back again and stay anytime.. one draw back was the train that ran under our window tooted from 7.15am on the hour..it would only bother someone who wanted a lay in...but who would want to miss a bit of this great city..

Reviews.Title: “Mom and Daughter Trip...Glad to have stayed here.”
Reviews.Author: A J
Reviews.Content: My mom had booked this hotel before we had talked about our options...and I was concerned when I saw the pictures and reviews, considering I am somewhat picky. However, I was very impressed with this hotel. It is definitely no-frills and small, but clean and comfortable. Any issues we had were addressed immediately. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is free, and the bagels and coffee were good. Also fresh fruit was available to grab and go for the day. As long as you don't mind walking, the location is great...we walked from the hotel to our Broadway shows, Times Square, the Subway, etc. Everything you need is within a few blocks. And you are so close to the Harbour Tours! There's a Duane Reade a couple of blocks away which is great for drinks and snacks for your room. Also there is an Italian Restaurant (Il Punto) within a couple blocks that if you mention you are staying at this hotel, you get a 10% discount (...get the Pera salad mmmmm!) We were 2 women travelling alone, and we felt safe walking around the area, even when we came back at midnight. I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel - I thought it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Tight Fit But Comfy...”
Reviews.Author: 72Mustang
Reviews.Content: Just a 1 Night stay. Comfortable nights rest. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Javits Center”
Reviews.Author: woody2762
Reviews.Content: If you have a conference at the Javits Center then this is the hotel for you. This hotel is a great middle of the road place to stay. The staff is very courteous, the rooms are clean and decent size by NYC standards and the free breakfast is a great buffet with a wide variety of choices. On the down side, you will have to walk about 13 minutes to get to a subway (8th Ave and 33rd St is probably the closest) and restaurants can be a bit of a hike. The neighborhood is not houses and shops, it's garages, bus parking areas, etc..but it's not dangerous and if you're there for a conference at the Javits, you can't beat it. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: SharonLCurrie
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel...the staff were fantastic, our room was small but very clean and it was only a 10 minute walk to Time Square. For the price we paid it was well worth it! We didn't see any homeless people walking to and from the hotel...at first seemed a bit sketchy but we never felt unsafe. We would recommend this hotel to friends and family and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad neighborhood, small room, weird smells”
Reviews.Author: BostonTraveler87
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this place is the value you get for your money. It's very inexpensive for New York, and you can see why when you first step in. I took a cab from the airport to get here, and I was grateful that I did not have to walk very far to get indoors. There's a gentleman's club a couple of buildings away, and lots of unsavory characters around the area, especially at night. The front desk takes a copy of your driver's license AND your credit card when you check in. The lobby is filthy. The elevator creaks a LOT and seems like it would break down during the ride. The room was very, very small, and smelled very weird. The size of the room didn't bother me much, I didn't expect a big room in New York. But the smell got to me. The room overall wasn't filthy dirty, but not clean either. The bed was clean enough to sleep in, but it was one of those experiences where I couldn't wait to shower when I got up out of it. The desk surface was slightly greasy, like it had not been cleaned in awhile. The front desk will not call a cab for you, you have to walk outside to call it yourself. Not a big deal, but just another thing on the list. Breakfast was included (again, the value for your dollar is great), but it wasn't exactly a healthy breakfast. I wasn't sure what I was eating half the time. I would never stay here again, not because it was that awful, but because there are other, better hotels for approximately the same price in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: jmfinn
Reviews.Content: The room I had was so small that I had to step over my suitcase to get to the bathroom which was small as well. This is one of the smallest rooms I have ever staid in. I have add more room on a cruise ship than in this hotel. The breakfast is free in the morning but they don't open until 7AM which was to late for me since I had to get to a meeting elsewhere. This is the only hotel I know of that doesn't serve breakfast at 6 or 7 AM You have to walk at least for blocks to eat at night since they have no dining on site.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff - free breakfast - scary neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: DeCman70
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here with my wife and overall was a very pleasant stay. Hotel decor is very old fashioned and rooms are small and dark but clean. Good base for midtown area of Manhattan but be warned you will have to walk through a few 'project' like streets adorned with homeless people which can be a bit intimidating but we werent bothered once. Staff in hotel were very friendly and the free bagels/doughnuts and coffee for breakfast is a bonus for New York. We were in New York just for the sightseeing/shopping and just wanted somewhere decent to lay our heads. This place delivered.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep and a center from which to explore”
Reviews.Author: wla2000
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Conference Center hotel provided a base for our six day visit to New York, and a comfortable king size bed. If you are looking for fancy amenities, look elsewhere. The room was small but by New York standards it was normal sized. The view was Westside industrial. As other reviewers mentioned there was train noise from the tracks below, but I don't think it was excessive. We have train noise regularly at our home near Detroit, and we get along OK. It's located west of 10th ave on 38 St., so it's 4 short blocks and 3 long blocks from Times Square, maybe 10 minutes. About the same distance from Penn Station. Those places are where you can catch subway trains, or there is frequent bus service on 9th and 10th Avenues. It's adequately close to public transportation in my opinion. We were assured by the clerk when we arrived that the neighborhood was safe, despite its gritty industrial location. We certainly had no incidents, and did feel relatively safe in the well-lit neighborhood. When we arrived on 38th Street we noticed a peculiar smell in the area and were a bit concerned. It turns out that a stable for carriage horses is just down the street from the hotel. So it turned out to be a horsey smell and ceased bothering us. One complaint I have is that the WiFi service was poor. At first it didn't work at all. I reported that to management, and they had it mostly fixed by morning. However, even then the performance from my room was very slow. It was also bad in the lobby, on my mobile computing devices, and also on the public computer terminal in the lobby, which was connected with WiFi. I was extremely underwhelmed by the hotel's attempt at providing a breakfast bar. I like a simple "continental" breakfast, but this barely qualified. We foraged at nearby groceries instead. The air conditioner worked ok except it made some extra noises that were sometimes bothersome. We should have reported the noises to management, but didn't, so that's really our own problem, I guess. The staff was friendly and responsive, so that's a plus if that's important to you. For example, they sent somebody up immediately when I reported I couldn't open the room safe. The room's firm but comfortable bed and the hotel's pretty good location were its best amenities, and earn it three stars.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations..will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: brit929
Reviews.Content: Myself and my 2 daughters aged 7 and 17 stayed here for 2 nights.It was very close to Times Square where we spent most of our time.We walked to and from the hotel and felt very safe.It is located just a block form the Hells Kitchen Fire Department and those gentlemen were out there most of the time selling tshirts and were very sweet.They had a mini fire engine with a board of all the firefighters that were lost in 9/11.I was not sure what to expect when I saw the star rating but was pleasantly suprised when we arrived.I have stayed in some very expensive hotels and the cleanliness as well as the staff was comparable to what we had at the Best Western.The day shift people and the manager Mike were wonderful..and always ready to help with a smile.There is a 24 hour garage across the street and other than the view it was not a disturbance at all.Very quiet rooms and extremely comfortable bed.The continental breakfast was as expected but when you have kids with you it is easy to have a little snack before venturing off to start the day..just enough to last until lunchtime.We had a wonderful stay in NY and we owe a big thanks to the Best Western Convention Center. I would definitely highly recommend and will recommend to my firends who are going to NYC in November.Thanks Again!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location for exhibitors and visitors of J.Javits convention center”
Reviews.Author: mauchi55
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 7 nights to attend a trade fair. This hotel is the closest one to the convention center, just 3 minutes walk. As we had a big luggage to take from the hotel to the convention center, it was very convenient. The room smells cheap detergent, but I got used to it. If you are staying on vacation, I don't recommend this hotel at all, but if you stay on business to go to the convention center and especially if you come with some display tools or samples, this hotel must be the most convenient one.

Reviews.Title: “Our Snow Storm Vacation in NY”
Reviews.Author: Alanis628
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western in December of 2010. The hotel is in a very central location, we were just a few blocks away from Times Square. When we arrived at the hotel the staff was very friendly and helpful and we had a good experience checking in. The rooms were small but very clean. It's very convenient that the hotel included breakfast specially after the big snow storm hit. The hotel entrance was kept clean and the snow was cleared for the guests. We had a great time in our vacation and I would 100% recommend this hotel for anyone that wants to stay in a central location and enjoy the sights around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: teuflova
Reviews.Content: I don't understand where are all negative rewiews from. This hotel is absolutely perfect, 10 minutes from Times Square for this value, what else can man wish for? The staff is very kind and always ready for help, room was small, but very clean, with new bed sheets and towels everyday. Breakfast was also good, there was everything for good start of the day. Only problem was that wifi didn't work on our iPhones, but on laptop worked well. If I come bavk to NY, I'll definitely stay here again. Can only reccomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Teeeerrrrible”
Reviews.Author: SchmooderMcDuck
Reviews.Content: Hands down the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in my entire life. I felt like I was in the wasteland of Cleveland, NOT Manhattan. The "breakfast" consisted of powdered eggs, no meat, dry cereal, and oranges and bananas. Good luck putting milk in your cereal because it says right on the carton "extended shelf life." I felt like this was free lunch they used to give out in the hood in the summer. Did I say it was terrible?! I booked this hotel because it did have breakfast included, but ended up going to Dunkin Donuts or Market Diner on 43rd and 11th because I absolutely could not stomach this alleged food. The rooms were super small, even by NYC standards. And they smelled badly. I was convinced there was a water leak somewhere because even with the AC on, the windows open, and spraying mass amounts of air freshener, I could never shake the musty, mildew smell. I stayed here for 7 nights and the "housekeeping" only changed the sheets and gave us new towels-no vacuuming, no cleaning of any kind. Gee, thanks. They even left gum on the bathroom floor which is now on my slippers. Gross! Forget about checking out early because they charge you $1 per bag to keep an eye on your bags. Seriously. There is also only one-that's right-ONE elevator which is used by not only the guests but also the entire housekeeping staff. So, as if the funk emanating from ever corner of the hallway wasn't enough, you also have to endure this pain whilst waiting for the elevator for about 5-10 minutes only to find there is no room for you because of a huge cleaning cart. There is an Amtrak train that runs directly under the hotel, which is exposed. Therefore, you hear horns starting at about 7:30 a.m. every. single. day. That was worse than the 24-hour taxi repair shop, who drills constantly. But wait-there's more!! Ya know the pretty little horses you see in Central Park pulling carriages? Guess where their stable is? That's right. About 50 feet to the right of this hotel. So you also get to see horse slave labor in action. When you walk in this hotel, you can either walk down about 10 steps or take the elevator. The elevator ONLY goes to the lobby and back. But the door doesn't shut, so please, just walk the steps. And it screeches. The internet didn't work some days, and you are advised to call an 800-number, which ALSO does not work. The bed itself was comfortable, but not the pillows. They were about the size of throw pillows. I would guess the bed size was a full or queen although we booked a king. Whatever-I was scared to leave the room and ask for another one because it could have been worse. The neighborhood also kind of sucks. You are going to have to walk 4 blocks to either 34th or 42nd to get on the train, then another 2.5 blocks to get to 8th Ave. It's definitely not scary or anything, but it's shady nonetheless. What, with all the various car mechanics, horsemen, and Amtrak horns. The Taj Mahal this place is NOT. I honestly don't even see how they can claim they are a 2-star hotel. I would give it 0.5 and that is being generous. Once again, in case you skimmed this review, the main point lies here: DON'T DO IT! Pros: There was a door with a functioning lock and a bed with sheets. Cons: Everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: irg19
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, the room was small but fine for two people. The bed was really great, loved it. The breakfast was delicious and the service was excellent. Two things I didn't like, our room was overlooking the train tracks and those things woke us up at 8 AM every morning with it's lovely "choo choos" and the hotel only has one (really slow) elevator, a 12 story (13 including the lobby) building really needs two elevators, we stayed on the 8th floor so we had to use the elevator a lot. All in all a good stay and I would recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Bomfa
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Priceline and thought i was a good deal for the price. Big mistake! It was terrible. The room was tiny, the breakfast was awful, the internet didn't work and the area is not good. And don't make the mistake of parking your car in front of the hotel, because it will be towed. Only stay here if you must be close to the convention center, otherwise stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Love New York”
Reviews.Author: CandE2378
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic for our needs!! The rooms may be smaller,but it is New york!! The rooms were cozy and clean and were always made up when we returned to the hotel. The staff was always friendly and willing to help us out with questions that we had. For travellers trying to stay on a budget the free breakfast was a great addition to get started in a busy day of exploring the city. As far as location,there may not be a coffee shop outside the door but walk ten minutes and your on 5th avenue surrounded with anything you want!! LOVE NEW YORK!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor location, tattered facility.”
Reviews.Author: Drumilford
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it was close to where I needed to be for business purposes. I was meant to stay three nights, but after the first night, I checked out. The location is sketchy. Walking from the hotel towards 8th avenue--its dark and deserted. The auto body shop across the street seriously does stay open all night and makes A LOT of noise. The lobby and the rooms are tattered. My bedspread and blanket had shredded parts, strings and looked like it was time for them to be thrown out. The smoke detector was hanging from the ceiling by a wire--it was not clean. I couldn't sleep with the noise from across the street. The 'breakfast' in the morning was a joke. The best part of this experience was that the desk manager let me check out early.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, good value, close to Times Square, Penn Station”
Reviews.Author: TravelerSaskatoon
Reviews.Content: Most of the other reviews summarize this hotel quite accurately. I just want to confirm that it is a good place to stay. Clean, affordable, small rooms. Lots of taxis on 10th Avenue. 10 minutes to MSG to see a hockey game. 10 minutes to Times Square in the other direction. No problems walking there after dark. Rooms were small, but we were never there except to sleep. We got a room on the 10th floor so it was quiet. Staff was very helpful. Arranged a town car for us for an early departure to La Guardia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneE17
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel in December. The staff had been advised that we would arrive extremely late at night as due to bad weather our plane was diverted to Washington, so we were exhausted on arrival having travelled for 24 hours. We found our room very clean and lovely and warm, and we even had a coffee maker with fresh coffee waiting for us. Breakfast was a basic choice, but there was always plenty to eat. The hotel is only a 15 minute walk to Macy's on 34th street, and the nearest subway, and we always felt safe. At all times the staff were polite, friendly and smiling. On departure our minibus airport transfer did not turn up, but immediately a phone call was made and the receptionist even came out into the street with us to ensure that we were collected and would not miss our flight. I can certainly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: JesMil
Reviews.Content: Listen. I had a great experience at this hotel. I don't understand where the negative feedback is coming from. So close to my convention at the Javits Center. Walked everywhere without fear. Without any problems. Courteous staff. Decent price. OK breakfast. An overall wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “New York warmth at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: FlightDelayed
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel is terrific - friendly, warm, helpful, and HONEST. AND they saved my husband's life. My husband left his very expensive camera on a chair in the breakfast area and a staffer immediately grabbed it, called our room (how they recognized him and knew the room number, I don't know), and before we could run downstairs to get it, they brought it to the room. Husband spared a very painful death! From check-in to check-out, they were really terrific. As others have said, the rooms are very small, but it is Manhattan, people. We paid $183/night (not Priceline - just booked directly) and that is a fantastic price for a hotel room in Manhattan. Rooms were spotless. I didn't think we would like the memory foam mattresses, but in fact they were extremely comfortable. NO BEDBUGS! The included breakfast was slightly better than the usual hotel freebie breakfast. Yes, there is a 24-hr auto repair shop across the street, but after 9 p.m., it wasn't noisy. Yes, there are train tracks and an occasional train. I happen to love the sound of trains, so for me this was a bonus. Location: People in Manhattan walk or take the subway. Cabs are not too expensive, but you don't take them unless it is late at night or quite far. We were with elderly parents so walking and subway were out of the question, which made the location of this hotel a bit problematic. We couldn't walk to Chelsea or mid-town for meals. That was simply too far for them. For us, it would have been no problem. True, there are no coffee shops on this block right now, but wait a few weeks...the area is developing rapidly. A few years ago, I wouldn't have walked there at night, but now it is fine. Clean, in good repair, plenty of street lights, fancy apartment buildings a block away, etc. If you are driving into the city, it couldn't be more convenient - a straight shot down the Henry Hudson Parkway from the GW Bridge or two blocks from the Lincoln Tunnel. Parking garage next door gives $10/night discount to guests of the Best Western (i.e., $33 night instead of $43).

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and adequate”
Reviews.Author: aselco
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on a $175 priceline bid (came to $200 with taxes). Honestly, I almost cried when I saw my priceline "win." I thought the dodgy street location would be scary for me a woman traveling solo. However, once I checked in, it was fine. Yes the hotel rooms are small, but it is New York. $3m apartments are small! My room was clean and comfortable. The staff was warm and welcoming. My only complaint is that there is nothing else on the street. One of the great things about New York is that you never have to go more than a half block for a bagel and coffee. Here you need to go a full block.

Reviews.Title: “Find a better hotel...”
Reviews.Author: kristin_sweet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel October 8-10 weekend. We booked it because we had a Best Western Gift card redeemed through airmiles. We ended up paying $264 a night plus taxes which it WAY too much for this hotel. If we had paid $130 or so then it would have been fine but there was a Comic Convention on this weekend and it was also Columbus Day (we are Canadian so I didn't realize this weekend was a holiday). It has small rooms which is fine because we were only there to sleep in them but it is definately on the low end of the best western chain. There are a few blocks when you are walking towards Times Square that are very sketchy. The continental breakfast is very basic, doesn't compare to other best westerns. There is only one elevator and 11 floors so a lot of times you are left waiting for like 10 minutes for the elevator. The front staff were not very friendly. The computer was down pretty much the entire weekend we were there. Overall I think there are much better hotels in this price range and as I said if I did not have the gift card we would not have stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Overall... fair”
Reviews.Author: nickiwms
Reviews.Content: stayed here via priceline ($105/night) for a midweek stay and it suited all our needs. Rooms are very small but clean. It did have an overpowering chemical orange smell that almost made me gag when i walked in but i guess i would prefer that smell over Body Odor or worse. although in a decent location, i definitely would recommend asking for a room not on the ground floor. There is a car repair garage open 24 hours across the street which provides for some seedy people hanging out on the street and knowing there was only a brick wall dividing us was somewhat unsettling.. this also made it for no real view out the window (not that i would want to see the garage, but you get my point). so, ask for a higher room if you can. i think this place is fine for the price but if i was traveling with girlfriends only or if parents are letting their kids travel alone, i feel like it is a tad too stetchy of an area to stay here esp if they will be coming in late with that car repair shop always having people lingering. i didn't interact with the staff too much but the person that holds bags was nice.

Reviews.Title: “good location for long weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: valeriemac40
Reviews.Content: this hotel took a bit of time finding since I decided to walk there with a heavy bag, lap top etc but once I got my bearings it was actually in a quiet part of town, close to the Hudson River. The only downside was that although continental breakfast was provided, you were asked to use the disposable crockery! This was a new experience to me but the breakfast was actually fine

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for the money and location”
Reviews.Author: luv2win929
Reviews.Content: I was a group leader for 22 people (mostly senior citizen women) on a train trip to NYC. Several of us usually take the trip by chartered bus annually, but this time decided to take the train. That was the best decision we could have made. This hotel is within walking distance to everything - Times Square, Broadway, 34th Street shopping district (Macy's) and all the other major shopping stores - not to mention the other smaller stores. A taxi ride anywhere we wanted to go was $5 or less plus tip. The rooms are small, but we didn't spend much time in the rooms anyway. The only bad thing I can say about the hotel is - for whatever reason - trash can in our room was never emptied during room service (3 nights) but they were quick to pick up the trash when we called at night. We had 8 rooms and as group leader, I heard no complaints from any of the group. The Continental breakfast was ample thus leaving only 2 meals to pay for each day. We had 48-hour passes on the Grayline and were able to walk to the nearest location to board the tour bus. The location and price of this hotel was key to this trip being one of our best yet! We booked early (6 months in advance) and got a really great rate. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but basic”
Reviews.Author: Perdylady75
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the BW in New York with my Mum for 5 days. We had a twin room which was clean and comfortable. The breakfast is basic with plastic cutlery! our rooms was very noisy as there were building works outside which kicked off at 3am. Air conditioning was noisy so had to leave window open. We asked to move rooms which they did for us but we ended up in the same sort of room with the same awful noise. The location is perfect walking distance to Times Square but not really work the $198 plus tax per night. Reception area desperately needs updating too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for bunch of friends”
Reviews.Author: girlUSA159
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with a bunch of visiting friends. It's a cheap hotel I found in NYC that has a brand name reputation. I can pretty much go around the country staying in different best western hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: NVEME702
Reviews.Content: There are many options for hotels in NYC but if you're looking for something comfortable and within close walking distance to time square- stay here! The room was very small but worked well for us two women- remember when it comes to room size, you're in NYC, they're all small! The breakfast was nothing too special but it did the job for a quick bite before going out for the day. The walk to time square is about 10 minutes, max. There is a 24 hour taxi cap workshop across the street- we received alot of whisles and "heyyyys" but overall we felt very safe no matter what time of day. This is a great, inexpensive way to visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: liljuhvit
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here during a 5-day-long trip to New York in June 2008. Our room was small (as expected), clean and had a nice view. Breakfast was alright. The hotel is located in an industrial area, but within walking distance to sights such as Times Square and Madison Square Garden. The area is very quiet (so you are likely to get a good sleep), but does unfortunately not inspire confidence at night. We always took a taxi when heading back to the hotel at night. There is really not much around the hotel, so if you need coffeehouses/shops/etc. right outside your hotel, you better not choose this one. Overall, the stay was ok, but we will choose another hotel when in NYC next time.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path, in a questionable neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: njarapteleh
Reviews.Content: I paid $172 per night for this hotel, which was the cheapest rate I could find for NYC on hotels.com. The first room I was assigned, had yellow phlegm in the toilet, and on the toilet seat, so I asked to be switched, after flushing the toilet. before going into the bathroom, I turned down the bedspreads from both beds, because I heard in an expose on hotel cleanliness that they don't wash those bedspreads between guests, only the sheets. I reported the phlegm to the manager, who went to the room, and denied finding any phlegm. I explained that I had already flushed the toilet, but there was still some remaining on the rim of the toilet. She just looked at me, as if "I" did it, because I had turned the bedspreads down, so she said, "You already used the room." I replied, "I had JUST walked in there. I turned the bedspreads down as soon as I arrived." My NEXT room had black hair ALL in the tub, and on the side. Who knows if the maid even cleaned the tub at all before I moved in. Exhausted, I just stayed in the room, and put towels down on the side of the tub, and in the basin of it, so I could shower, and get the h**l out of that dump as soon as possible the next day. After drinking their juice for the continental breakfast, I got the "runs". This establishment is unsanitary, and in a neighborhood that seems to be an industrial district, right across the street from a tire/mechanic shop, that apparently stays open all night, with guys hanging around....sitting. I would not recommend this establishment (so-called) under ANY circumstances. I know I certainly will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: grischnackh
Reviews.Content: No complaints here. The staff are really friendly and sweet, there's free internet/computer usage at reception, and free breakfast (pastries, oranges, cereal, toast, coffee) is always a nice touch. Location is a bit out of the way for sight seeing, not sure how close it is to public transport as we were only here for a night. The rooms and beds are comfortable, nice bath products etc. Curtains for the main room window would be nice as it was a little too light to sleep in with the see thru shade. Good value for the price in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Two Stars and deserves it.”
Reviews.Author: Edith2000
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small which is standard for NYC and face it the location of this hotel is lacking and is down right crappy but the hotel was one block from the Javitz Center so what the heck. Front desk staff was helpful and friendly and the dining area and continental breakfast was standard and what is expected. The ability to make waffles would have been nice however. Our room, 1007, was clean but the temperdic mattress took up most of the room. Instead of two twins pushed together with the gap not bridged in an attempt to make a king size bed, better to have just installed a full size mattress. That way both of us could get in bed from either side. As currently configured hubby was able to get in from his side I had to crawl into and out bed from the foot. Not cool. Further hanging a window curtain with out ironing it made the room look tacky and looks like you just don't care. I would also recommended ear plugs since there are train tracks running next to the hotel so you hear the train going by frequently. I travle with ear plugs so I was prepared. Aside from thesel complaints and yes I would stay here again but you get what you pay for so I feel I was charged fairly.

Reviews.Title: “4 Women, 1 Room - Worked out Great!!”
Reviews.Author: travlinmel101
Reviews.Content: We arrived early, but there was a room ready for us to check in. We had a room with “two double beds.” The room was a little snug, but nothing unbearable. The beds were on “legs” tall enough to slide your luggage under for storage. It said the room had two double beds, but they seemed larger. The mattresses were made of that “memory foam” stuff. There was a window, which you could open. A small desk with chair and another chair. There was an armoire/TV stand that had closet space and a safe. A small bed stand with radio/alarm clock & lamp and another lamp was in the room. The bathroom was nice, spacious countertops, full tub/shower, and a hair dryer. The continental breakfast included milk, orange juice, and coffee for beverages. The food menu varied slightly every morning. There were cartons of cereal, toast (white and wheat), muffins, danishes, and sometimes hard boiled eggs. A very nice start to the day. There was also a vending machine for sodas/bottled water ($2) and a vending machine for snacks. For the price, location was great! (We paid $386 per person for 4 nights & Airfare on expedia.) The hotel is located on 38th Street between 10th and 11th, Times Square, for example, is about 47th and 8th/7th…so…we walked up 38th street, turned left, then walked up 8th. It was a very interesting walk, but, after a few times we decided to start taking a taxi. The cost for taxi from the hotel to Times Square was about $7 (+tip). (With 4 people splitting the cost, it was MUCH FASTER and easier to take a taxi.) The cost of taxi to Statue of Liberty was about $13. There’s not a “taxi company” that the hotel can call to have a taxi come pick you up, so you have to hail your own cab. Occasionally, we got lucky and a taxi was going by. Otherwise we would walk up to 10th or 9th then get a cab from there. On our last night, we had a very nice taxi driver, so we asked him if he would like to come pick us up and take us to the airport the next day; he gave us his phone number, we called him the next day, he was there in 10 minutes. The ride from/to JFK is a flat rate of $45 + $5 toll = $50 + tip. Other amenities of the hotel include ice machine, ATM, computer in lobby for internet, and elevator. The hotel will hold your luggage for you for $1.00 per person/luggage (technically we had 8 “pieces” of luggage, but he kind of counted them together and charged us $4.00.) The staff were all nice, friendly, helpful. The hotel was clean, comfortable, and I felt safe (even though it doesn’t LOOK like the best part of town). MISC. NOTES: There is an Amtrak train that runs close to the hotel. We only heard the train twice while we were there. We heard it the first time just about 5 minutes after we got into our room (and we were thinking OH GREAT!), but then, the only other time we heard it was at like 8:15am one of the mornings…otherwise, we weren’t in the room long enough to notice and it did not go through at night. On 38th, between 10th and 9th there is a little fire station, which is neat to see. There were some memorials from 9/11 which was both sad, yet, a little historic. Also, from that same location, you can see the top of the Empire State Building (so pretty at night, all lit up). Our first day there, we needed just a light lunch, so we took a walk & found a place called “Burgers and Cupcakes” (on 9th, between 35th & 36th). It was good food, but for $6.50 we we’re expecting our burgers to be bigger than the ones at McDonald’s…pretty close size, but MUCH better quality! The sweet potato fries were delicious! There were several different kinds of cupcakes, like red velvet, carrot cake, yellow, and chocolate ($2.50 for a regular sized one, $3.50 for a larger one). (Just try sitting close to the windows; we were close to the bathroom, kinda gross & STINKY!)

Reviews.Title: “Decent value - place to drop your bags and sleep”
Reviews.Author: epsharon
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 1am so was worried I wouldn't get the type of room I reserved but luckily the room had two double beds. The location of the hotel is great for sightseeing as well as proximity to other hotels that have business conferences. I had two seminars, one in the Belvedere and one at the Holiday Inn on 58th St. and both were within 15-20 minute walks which was great. It is a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square and a bit farther for Rockefeller Center. The room was small, very small but we managed. What was disgusting was the comforter on the bed and one set of sheets actually had a blood stain. Since it was so late I just made due and asked housekeeping to change the sheets the next morning. The shower and toliet worked fine but the sink was small and looked like it was going to fall off the wall at any moment. A couple of great amenities were the continental breakfast in the morning, free wireless throughout the hotel and a computer workstation with free internet in the lobby. The beds are actually decent but again, beware of the comforters. The noise level was acceptable. You could hear noise from the hallways (i.e. doors slamming, etc.) pretty easily but outside noise wasn't much of a factor. One morning we heard a jackhammer and a different night a train came through somewhat close to the hotel and we heard it blow it's whistle. We paid $225/night including taxes so compared to other hotels with a similar location we thought we made out ok. They do offer to store bags on the day of checkout but they charge $1/bag and the bags are just placed in the lounge area of the hotel and I'm pretty sure the guy who checked my bags stays in the room all day and guards them as he was sitting at a table in the lounge when we came back to retrieve our bags six hours later. P.S. It was a $40 cab ride from LaGuardia including tip.

Reviews.Title: “space-heater-heated, cold, smokey room with a alarm repeatedly sounding”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_2009_Z
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Convention Center Hotel has confirmed that they rented out not only my room but other rooms as well without working heating systems with overnight low temperatures of 42 degrees in New York City. The management said, "We told them that it was simply unacceptable for our guests to stay in our hotel without heat." Unbelievably, the management then rented out these rooms with small space-heaters without any respect for their customers or their brand. I paid for a king-sized-bed room. Without any warning, I slept a twin-sized bed in the cold with a smokey space-heater that caused the smoke alarm to repeatedly wake me. My important trip was adversely impacted. The management says twin beds with space heaters with 42 degree outside temperatures are in keeping with Best Western's brand. Only a smokey room is slightly inconvenient. They offered a 10% discount. I have stayed in no-name extremely inexpensive hotels in the wintertime in mainland China who have a standard of quality that vastly exceeds Best Western's. In Manhattan there is no reason to ever willingly accept this situation. If you are forced to stay here check for two twin beds (each with their own set of sheets) deceptively hidden under a single king-sized bedspread. When I complained, the management called this their idea of a "California King." This seems like a simply illegal bait and switch to me. Immediately check to make sure the heating and cooling system works. Immediately verify that your smoke alarm will not repeatedly sound during the night. Wait, I believe this is impossible, I advise staying in any of the plethora of other hotels that have heat and at least a modicum of concern for their guests and their reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Central Convenient Location - Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatieG18
Reviews.Content: First time in NY and found this hotel. Very reasonably priced for the centre of NY. Everything really convenient - a couple of blocks from Times Square, Subway Station and bus centre. Rooms really clean and quite good size for me and my friend. Very reasonable breakfast included in the price (choices of cereals, toast, pastries etc). Not the most appealing outlook with a garage and building site beside, but no complaints on the noise. Very quiet location. Hotel service very good as staff sorted out everything we requested.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: Caroline60302
Reviews.Content: nice location at one block of Times Square, the hotel was ok, good just a week end... nice room but no curtains so hard to sleep with the BIG sign of the hotel in front of my window...

Reviews.Title: “If you need to be close to the Javits, this place is just fine.”
Reviews.Author: GeorgieA
Reviews.Content: Completely adequate hotel. Rooms small but clean, Wifi works okay, TV doesn't have a zillion channels, but it has CNN and Weather. Continental breakfast is fine if you don't need sausage and eggs and pancakes. The location is what it is: if you need to be close to the Javits center, you can't get any closer. The street is totally industrial, but in fact is never empty since there's a 24-hour auto body shop across the street (catering to taxicabs). Didn't feel unsafe. Plenty of cabs on 10th Avenue any time. Also a 24-hour Dunkin Donuts (in a gas station) and a great little bar/restaurant, Hudson Yards, on 10th and 35th. Amazingly quiet hotel--but the street can be a bit noisy, so make sure you get a room in the back. In a couple of years, this area will be filled with high rises and will be very different, but for now, the hotel is definitely recommended if you need to be in that spot.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: xyzxyzxyz
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights at this hotel while attending a conference at the Javits Convention Center in midtown Manhattan. My experience: It's in a weird-but not scary-neighborhood. There's a big 24 hour taxi repair place right across the street, a building under construction on the right and a horse barn of some kind ('m not kidding!) on the left. But I walked around til 11 pm by myself every night I was there and didn't feel unsafe at all. It can be noisy. The noise isn't from the other rooms or from the hallways, but from the outside. But I'm a mountain girl, so maybe I'm a bit sensitive on this point. Anyway, I always travel with earplugs, so it wasn't a big deal. There's nothing fancy about it, but it's clean and has everything you need, plus a little more, like a pc and printer in the lobby for guest use. The staff was really nice and helpful, which is always a big plus in my book. They feed you a continental breakfast -nothing fancy, but you'll find something to hold you over - cereal, toast, muffins, jiuce, etc. The absolutely best thing was the location. Truly just a half a block from the 11th Avenue entrance of the Convention Center! It's also just 7-8 blocks to Times Square - maybe a 20 minute trek by foot. The in-room wifi was free and better than I've experienced in most hotels. The clientelle is average folks on a budget from all over the world and they all seemed happy to be there. It was half the price of other hotels in the area and I was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “NYC: Expensive”
Reviews.Author: feelingrandy
Reviews.Content: One assumes that if there is a convention nearby, this is a great place to stay. For the casual visitor to New York City...not so much. The location is not great for transportation by train, but there are plenty of taxi's. It is across the street from what must be a 24 hour auto shop, which seems to like drilling in the night. There is also a train track next door and once a day the place shudders with the train going by. We were treated to on our first day no to no elevator and the second day, no hot water between 12-3 pm. Once inside, it not the largest room, but for the money you can surely find smaller. We actually had a great view. It did feel a little lonely out there on 10th Avenue and that may be its biggest drawback.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, 15 minuse walk form subway”
Reviews.Author: Shai51
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using the betting option at priceline.com. We got a room at the high season of September for 120$/night – good value for money for a hotel in Manhattan. Hotel is clean. Rooms are small, but good enough after walking all day. It is including continental breakfast. One disadvantage is the location. It is located at west 38th street. 15 minutes walking form a subway station. But it is safe to walk around at night. There is a train that passes near the hotel. Sometimes too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable....Great Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: Cherylcyn
Reviews.Content: Having never been to NYC before, I wasn't expecting alot from this hotel for the price. I was pleasantly surprised! The location looked a little funky, but once inside, the front desk staff was courteous and friendly and the lobby was clean and cheerful. Once in our room, it was small, but clean with a comfortable bed. We felt very safe there and had a excellent experience! I would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Wolverine101
Reviews.Content: I searched high an low for a good affordable hotel which was not rat infested!!!! The Western is not bad at all. It is basically a travelodge. Clean small sized room. Nice power shower. Had a safe. 10-15 minute walk from times square and Maceys. Breakfast consists of cereal, doughnuts and bagels.The hotel is opposite a 24hr mechanic which can be noisy therefore you ideally want a room at the back of the hotel rather than the front otherwise ear plugs do the job just fine. They are building skyscareprs either side of the hotel but never heard a peep from there so dont worry when u get there that it will noise central!!! It really isnt. The area does not look all that great but in a week never experienced any probs and on occassion was walking back at 2-3am. Overall it is a great hotel for the price

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at affordable rates”
Reviews.Author: theyoungindian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good value for money. It is located slightly away from times square and Broadway, the buzzing areas of NYC. Otherwise, the hotel has good amenities, very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough!”
Reviews.Author: LVinWA
Reviews.Content: It's a Best Western and knowing that NYC in this price range offers postage stamp-sized rooms, it worked out fine. I had some hesitation reading reviews here, but the staff was terrific, the rooms were fine, complimentary breakfast a huge convenience, and all in all was satisfied. Especially with the staff. I was one of the few Americans here, with Europeans making up the majority of guests. Breakfast was typical BW continental style. Remember that the rooms are very small (which is typical in NYC) and they could stand updating but free WiFi and breakfast with a relatively central location? You're good to go!

Reviews.Title: “Spend the Extra $ to stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: brandables
Reviews.Content: My husband an I took Super Shuttle from the airport and were one of the last to get dropped off. We watched everyone go to these nice looking hotels and then drove through a not-very-nice looking part of time and voila, this was the Best Western. The help staff was very nice, however when we got to our floor, the entire floor smelled like smoke. And when we opened the door to the room it was almost as if the bed touched all four walls. I don't think our luggage would have even fit in the room with us. The place would be good for young travelers really trying to save some money, but for a married couple trying to have a nice stay in NYC it is not the place. We didn't stay the night and instead went to the Courtyard Marriott. Twice the price, but still a good deal for Manhattan and MUCH more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't beat price at that location”
Reviews.Author: bray_john
Reviews.Content: I raved about it. For midtown Manhattan the price was great. In fact, it was so good I was wary until I got there and saw my room. Small, sure, but I couldn't see much difference with a Holiday Inn Express room. Breakfast was basic, but filling and included in the price. WiFi in the room worked well, which is important to me when I travel. In fact the only quibble I had was when I asked where I could find a plug adapter for my laptop. I'd forgotten mine. The guy at the desk told me to go all the way to 48th and 8th Ave, but I found one only two blocks away on 8th Ave between 37th & 38th. I recommended it to everyone I met on the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: hartstar99
Reviews.Content: I think that this was a great hotel for the money....via Priceline. The room was small but very clean and always pretty quiet. It is a little out of the way but you walk from Times Square, right near a firestation and then are there so it's not too bad plus there is always the taxi option.

Reviews.Title: “Economical and Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: PakPryde
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 days there and it was very pleasant. I walked everyday to Times Square and Broadway, which is about 10-15 mins. Room was small and clean, but the bedskirt was ripped. Continental Breakfast was pretty good. This Hotel is really good for the people who are in NYC for sightseeing and spend most of the time outside their room. Hotel has a security service which charges $1 per bag to hold.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Western”
Reviews.Author: djk333
Reviews.Content: So, I obviously I stayed at a two star hotel, and I’m not expecting the amenities of the Ritz Carton, but this place was a TOTAL dump. Where do I start? First of all we got a King size bed, which was actually two beds put side by side to make it look like a king. That wasn’t that bad. But the room was SO small. The room had an armoire with hangers where you could hang up your clothes because there was no closet. But you couldn’t open up the armoire all the way because the room was too small and it hit the bed. The hotel’s location is pretty crappy because it’s about a 15 minute walk from the closest subway station. There’s nothing around the hotel, and the neighborhood is a bit shady. (next to a gentleman’s club) Our room was fairly clean minus the several pubic hairs I saw on our comforter, and on our counter in the bathroom. Gross!!! The thing that bugged me the most was that the major TV networks did not work on our TV. When I went to complain to the hotel, they said that there was nothing they could do because there was construction going on next door. I tried 2 times to talk to a manager about getting some sort of compensation, but the manager had not been on duty. I called the hotel and spoke with the manager and he said that because I had gotten a low rate through Priceline ($107 before taxes) that they couldn’t compensate me anymore. They did offer to give me a discount the next time I stayed there, and I explained to the manager thank you, but I will never stay there again. This should be rated a 1 star hotel. I do not recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: fromlatola
Reviews.Content: I am pretty positive I brought home bed bugs from this hotel. They started infesting my apartment around the same time we got home from our vacation. They have made our lives a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotle”
Reviews.Author: HomeTourist1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 5 nights. Rooms are more than OK, not too small. it depens on what you seek. If you just seek a place to sleep this is a great hotel. Our room was always clean, fresh towells, fresh sheets etc etc. Breakfast was ok, no complains at all. Don't expect too much but it's good The neighbourhood is not unsafe, really we walked their at 2-3 AM, no probs at all. 10min walk from times square and subway. Fact is that they are working next to hotel so their is some noise very early but we never noticed it because we were so tired after a whole day of walking around the city :) If you want luxe you have to book the Hilton of the Plaza but you will also pay the prize. This is a very good for it's prize (if you compare with others) hotel with hard working people. Great for tourists

Reviews.Title: “Thieves in the room”
Reviews.Author: jpcastner
Reviews.Content: When we checked in I foolishly mentioned that we'd just been to Mexico City. We got to our room and the room safe was locked closed. We called the front desk to report it and they said they would take care of it that evening or the next day. We hid our passports in our clothes and went out to dinner. When we got back our passports were gone. The keys are of the card type and are renewed upon each check in.

Reviews.Title: “First time in New York”
Reviews.Author: B10path
Reviews.Content: If you are out and about you don't need a room at the Ritz, this hotel will serve your purpose. We stayed for 5 nights and returned each night to sleep and plan our next day. Rooms were clean but on the small side, the breakfast had a good selection and the walk to downtown was average distance. Made my way around to a play, the US open tennis and the David Letterman Show. Would love to return to Manhattan and would have no problem staying again at this location.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel; Not the greatest location”
Reviews.Author: ryandk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Convention Center Hotel in New York City from August 15 - 22, 2008. I visit New York City almost every summer for about a week, and was a bit scared when I got this hotel through Priceline. The hotel itself is quite nice. The bed was comfortable, and the room wasn't too small. The best part about staying here was the free breakfast and free hi-speed internet. Internet is available at a terminal in the lobby, or you can borrow an ethernet cable to use with your laptop in your room. Breakfast was available between 7 and 10am, and consisted of various cereals, bagels, toast, danishes, muffins, apples and bananas, orange juice, apple juice and coffee. Simple, but just what you need to get you going in the morning. The location of the hotel was a bit of a downside. It took me almost half and hour to walk to one of the Broadway shows one evening just because there were so many people around. The hotel is located southwest of Times Square on 38th street at 10th Avenue. The neighbourhood isn't unsafe, but I'd avoid walking near the Port Authority. Lots of homeless people around there at night. I felt it was a bit far from many things. If you have problems walking, don't stay here. If you don't mind a good walk (I walked everywhere, from the hotel to the Guggenheim in the upper 80's, and to the southern tip of Manhattan Island), this hotel isn't so bad. There are many more centrally located hotels, but if you don't mind walking, this is an affordable alternative.

Reviews.Title: “MIRROR FELL ON TOP OF HUSBAND AND IT WAS PUT ON THE BILL!”
Reviews.Author: oldertraveler2
Reviews.Content: My husband was going to take a shower before retiring for the evening. There was no rubber bath mat nor was there a towel type mat in the bathroom. A set of towels for each of us was provided, with no extra towel. He looked at the bottom of the tub, and there were faint gray ovals on the bottom of the tub. He assumed that this meant that it was a non-slip surface by looking at it, especially since no mat was provided. He turned on the water, and then started to get into the shower. His foot slipped out from under him and he fell heavily to the floor, taking the shower curtain and its rings with him. He fell with such force that the mirror fell from the wall above the sink, broke against the edge of the sink, and then landed on top of him. (The mirror was attached to the wall with only two small flat clips.) Small pieces of the mirror cut his chest, legs, hands, and near his ear. These were all small cuts, nothing major, and I always pack band-aids just to be on the safe side. Luckily he was not badly hurt, especially when you are talking about a 61 year old man falling in the manner that he did. I called the front desk and told them what had happened. A gentleman came up and tried to clean up the shards from the mirror, but there were small pieces that he was unable to get up with the broom. I called the front desk while he was in the room and asked if we could move to another room since the bathroom floor wasn’t safe to walk on without shoes, but I was told that no other room was available that evening. The man who came to help us got us a new shower curtain and brought up some ceiling tiles to put on the floor along with some extra towels. He couldn’t find any shower curtain rings, so he brought me some pieces of string for me to use to put the shower curtain up. I had cleaned up the blood with the wash cloth and he told me to just put that in the trash can, which I did. The next morning I went down to the front desk and asked to speak to the manager. I was told that he would not be in until Monday morning. Our phone number was taken down and I was given a card with the hotel information on it. I asked the man at the desk to please let housekeeping know that the floor really needed to be carefully mopped since there were still tiny pieces of mirror on the floor. This was done. No new shower curtain rings were put up; the mirror was not replaced. We were given a towel type bath mat. On Sunday morning we went to the front desk to check out and were told that a $130 charge for the mirror and a $10 charge for the curtain rings were added to our bill since we broke them. Once again I went through the entire account, and the young woman then removed the charges, but we were told that they might be put back on our bill on Monday. I reiterated that we wanted the manager to call us. Our daughter noticed that the notes that were sitting on the front desk had highlighted the statement that we broke the mirror, not that there was a fall and the mirror fell off the wall and broke on top of my husband.. This entire ordeal has left us extremely disappointed with Best Western Hotels. To begin with, this event never should have occurred. You either provide your guests with a bath mat of some sort, or your tubs have non-slip surfaces. You should also mount your mirrors with a stronger type of anchoring system than what was used. If and when an unfortunate event like this does occur, you do not bill your guests for damages that occurred through no fault of their own. We were upset that this happened to him to begin with, and billing us for the mirror and shower curtain rings made matters a hundred times worse. All that my husband wanted to do was take a shower safely. That certainly is not too much to ask of a hotel. The manager has yet to call us, and it is over a week since this happened. He told the Best Western people to say that he was sorry. They have also asked him repeatedly to call us. The charges were not added back on to the bill, and the owner did not make any other adjustment to our charges to compensate us for this. I can't imagine what would have happened if he had broken his hip when he fell.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading Best Western - Parking almost a mile away”
Reviews.Author: EducatedTraveler
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely horrible! I read a few reviews, and thought I'd take a chance because I usually like the Best Western brand and enjoy earning points for my stays. However, I would not recommend this place. Just as the other reviewers stated, the hotel is in an isolated area of Manhattan. It's just 2 blocks from the Lincoln Tunnel exit, and I wouldn't recommend walking to/from the hotel at night. Parking was the worst part. You leave the keys with Central Parking, the official parking for this Best Western hotel, and you walk 2 schleps (which are 2x regular city blocks), plus another 2.5 blocks to get to this hotel. The sidewalks you have to use to get to the hotel are all blocked off, under construction, or have potholes in them (I know - strange for sidewalks to have holes in them!). It's a long walk, and the hotel staff 'forgot' to mention this. Instead, they said, "Oh it's not far away at all." It was. Also, the nearest subway station is just about as far as the parking lot, and the station is next to a NYPD police station -- so you can imagine the riftraft hanging near there after being released. I would highly, highly recommend staying at another hotel, even if it's pricier, because the inconvenience and lack of service at this hotel is not worth its 'low' price. Oh - and parking is an additional $30 by the way, which is NOT included in your hotel rate/stay. The hotel staff didn't even know where the nearest cabs were, nor did they have names or phone numbers so that we could call a cab...totally useless staff.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you are DESPERATE”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior2008
Reviews.Content: The All Star Game was being played in New York and every hotel room was taken, or so it seemed according to my travel agent. I was booked at this hotel. The people at the desk are nice and helpful. The problem is the room. It is essentially 12 feet by 12 feet.. no exaggeration. The bed, desk, lamps, chair and closet are all crowded into that little tiny. area. The hotel is located across from a 24/7 car repair shop that fixes New York cabs all night long so the tire machines and all the other related machinese are banging all night long. The Amtrak train track runs alonside the hotel so all the trains go up and down and you hear all that noise as well, in addition to New York's Finest Fireman racing to a fire and blaring their sirens as they go. The firehouse is only a block away. You don't have to go to Broadway for entertainment. You will get it live and in concert all night long.. I fully guarantee it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, cheerful staff and isolated location”
Reviews.Author: Moonsoon33
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Convention Centre Hotel (BWCCH) is great value if you pay less than $200/night. I booked the BWCCH through Priceline and bid (and paid) $150/night. May sure you try even a lower bid, as others have paid less. Yes, as with other reviews, I was quite sad when I got the reply from Priceline that I got the BWCCH. Having lived in Manhattan and visited a number of times, I had no idea the BWCCH even existed. It really is in the middle of no where, except for being a block from the Jarvits Convention Centre. It's a very fast 12 minute walk to the A, C & E subway line, which you can enter at 40th street and 8th avenue. I never felt unsafe walking back at 1 a.m. in the morning, but the area was quite deserted. I stayed in Room 1104 (top floor, 2 double beds). The room is actually quite a bit bigger than other Manhattan hotel rooms which I've stayed (in particular the minature-sized 30-30 Hotel). The bathroom is nice, clean and modern. The bed and mattress was very comfortable. I did notice that I got a few bites on my arms during my stay - not sure if it was bed bugs or something else I came into contact with during my stay in Manhattan. The free breakfast was okay. It consisted of: cereal, milk, juice, muffins, apples, bananas, doughnuts and bagels. It was not spectacular; rather, it did the trick until late lunch. I thought the coffee made in the hotel room tasted better than the free breakfast coffee. The location of the hotel is the main reason why I did not rate my experience as a 4 out of 5. Just being so deserted and isolated, made the walk back to the hotel very lonely and depressing. Be prepared for a walk if you stay here or paying a lot for taxis. The hotel and rooms are fine, clean and the staff is friendly. The cleaning staff even left me a 'thank-you' note when I left a small tip on the bed. The cleaning staff did a great job. Yes, for the right price and the right time of year (not winter or super hot summer months) I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for short stay, those who don't mind walking”
Reviews.Author: goldies3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed over the 4th of July weekend. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly upon check-in. The location is not too convenient unless you are using the convention center. Rooms are a reasonable size for a New York City hotel. Bathrooms are small, but very nice and clean. We loved the bed - it had a memory foam mattress and was extremely comfortable. The noise from the trains and the shop across the street did not bother us, but it probably helped that we always take a white noise machine with us to hotels. Neighborhood is industrial, but not unsafe. Some of the reviews have said the neighborhood is dangerous, but we did not feel that way. You can definitely smell the horses from the barn next door, but not for long as we didn't hang out outside the hotel and went on our way. On future visits, I would prefer to stay elsewhere, but mostly for location.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations, a bit like a "boutique" hotel”
Reviews.Author: barefoot14
Reviews.Content: I wasn't so happy when I first got this hotel on Priceline. Web reviews were horrible and the neighborhood is full of car repair shops. No character there! However, I was more than pleasantly surprised and I would definitely stay there again. If you are at the Javits Center, it is only one-half block walk. The horse-drawn carriages are prepared out front so if you like horses you will be in heaven. The hotel is new, very clean, the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. The bed was exceptionally comfortable and the fourth floor room by the elevator was the quietest I have ever had in NYC. The included breakfast was great for a continental style, lots of choices including fresh croissants, fruit, cereal, juices, doughnuts etc. The room had coffeemaker, safe and iron and ironing board. It is a quick and easy walk to Macy's, Penn Station, Madison Square Garden area. The hotel was filled with European travelers, my last day I finally met a family from Kentucky. They also loved the small boutique feeling that this Best Western offers. The only downs were the small room (I shared with a friend, we had two twins pushed together like a king) and the view. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: theboofer
Reviews.Content: Good points: 1) Somewhat close to Penn Station, where I entered the city. 2) Relatively clean, but nowhere near pristine. About what I expected at this price. Bad points: 1) They claimed that they were giving me a queen sized bed, but in fact, they took a queen sized headboard and put two twin beds together. This alone was pretty unacceptable, but when we approached the front desk, they were unhelpful and just said that all of their queen beds are like that. Are you serious?? 2) Nothing of interest within 5 blocks of this place. About what I expected at this price. 3) Continental breakfast was pretty lousy. Again, what I expected at this price. Other points: 1) The hotel is kind of off the beaten trail, and there is major construction being done next to the hotel. It isn't terribly well-lit, but I never really felt unsafe walking back to the hotel at 3am. That said, if I were a female and alone, I would exercise a little bit of caution. 2) Only one elevator for the entire hotel. It's a smaller hotel but it went out for a little while when we were leaving and we had to walk down 10 flights of stairs. 3) If you could get a room for $100/night (taxes included), I would probably recommend this hotel. However, I don't really know if that's a feasible price point. They advertise for roughly $220/night plus taxes, which is outrageous. I would stay in 20 other hotels in the city before this one at ~$260/night. Summary: I don't think I would stay here again, if only because of the bed situation. It's pretty sleazy to advertise a queen bed and then let your guests find out that they just mashed two twin beds together. I'd rather spend my money to stay somewhere in a nicer area.

Reviews.Title: “very basic and clean”
Reviews.Author: dreamvac
Reviews.Content: The BW Convention Center is a very basic hotel that is a few blocks away from Broadway and Macy's. It is in an industrial area, but only a couple of blocks from 9th avenue where there are some reasonable restaurants. We booked our room through hotwire. It was the least expensive hotel we could find in midtown that had a private bath. We drove to the hotel and were directed to park at a lot 3 blocks away at a "discounted" rate of $30 a night. The hotel is just a place to crash at night. Not somewhere you would want to relax in. It is right across the street from a 24 hour garage. Our room faced the street and it was a bit noisy. I would ask for a room on the other side next time. The room was clean but small with basic furnishings. I felt the hotel was secure and the area safe to walk around despite the industrial feel of the area. For those on a budget it is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: europeantourists
Reviews.Content: Got the hotel on Hotwire, so we actually not selected it ourselves. Paid 179 dollar + taxes for three persons (one week´s stay). Must be a good price on Manhattan. Stayed on the 11:th floor. It was rather small but very clean and neat. The Tempura mattresses was comfortable and it was nice to have a safe for money and tickets. The bathroom was very good. The breakfast was better than expected. There were fresh fruits, boiled eggs and cereals and lots of sweets like donuts and muffins (and people had it for breakfast!?) The staff didn´t great you mornings and evenings, exept for the cleaningladies. A little bit rude I think. There where no protestors the week we stayed. We thought the neighborhood was safe. We are very pleased with our stay and had a wonderful week in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience with the hotel, never again.”
Reviews.Author: susanBellevue
Reviews.Content: I have booked the hotel from hotels.com for my family vacation. We paid for 220.00/night for two nights, plus 100 for an additional person. The room is so small, no space for the luggages.. We have to put the luggage on the top of the chair. There is train path close to the hotel, each night, we would be waked up few times by the passing train noises. For price over $300.00 for the condition in NYC, it is much over priced. Our terrible experience came to the day of check out. First of all, it was our mistake remembering wrong check out date. We thought the check out date was 28 but it actually was 27. We came back to hotel at around 8:00PM, and the room was locked out. We came to the front desk and were told that we already passed the check out time, and would be charged a full day rate for the day and let us leave immediately. I talked to the on site manager that it was a mistake we made, and If we charged the full day rate, we should have the room for the night. But the manager told me that all the rooms were sold out, I can not get any room. I thought that the person who booked our room had not checked in yet, if we move out at this time, we actually not cause any financial lose to the hotel, I asked for a discount/half day charge if we can not stay at the night. I get refused, too.
